{
    "number": 190807,
    "data": "1,2,4,5,8,10,11,14,16,20,22,23,28,29,32,40,41,44,46,47,56,58,59,64,65,68,80,82,83,86,88,92,94,95,112,116,118,119,122,128,130,131,136,137,140,160,164,166,167,172,173,176,184,188,190,191,194,203,224,232,236,238,239,244,245,248,256,257,260,262,263,272,274,275,280",
    "name": "Increasing sequence generated by these rules:  a(1)=1, and if x is in a then 2x and 3x-1 are in a.",
    "comment": [
        "See A190803."
    ],
    "link": [
        "Reinhard Zumkeller, <a href=\"/A190807/b190807.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000</a>"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "h = 2; i = 0; j = 3; k = -1; f = 1; g = 9 ;",
        "a = Union[Flatten[NestList[{h # + i, j # + k} &, f, g]]]  (* A190807 *)",
        "b = a/2; c = (a + 1)/3; r = Range[1, 900];",
        "d = Intersection[b, r] (* A190849 *)",
        "e = Intersection[c, r] (* A190850 *)"
    ],
    "program": [
        "(Haskell)",
        "import Data.Set (singleton, deleteFindMin, insert)",
        "a190807 n = a190807_list !! (n-1)",
        "a190807_list = f $ singleton 1",
        "   where f s = m : (f $ insert (2*m) $ insert (3*m-1) s')",
        "             where (m, s') = deleteFindMin s",
        "-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 01 2011"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A190803, A190849, A190850."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn",
    "offset": "1,2",
    "author": "_Clark Kimberling_, May 20 2011",
    "references": 4,
    "revision": 9,
    "time": "2013-07-13T12:04:09-04:00",
    "created": "2011-05-25T17:58:23-04:00"
}
